meanings.definition: A rhetorical device in which a work of art is described in detail within another work of art.
meanings.sent1: In the story, the author used ecphrasis to vividly describe the painting hanging in the protagonist's room.
meanings.sent2: The poet's ecphrasis of the sculpture brought the artwork to life through words.
meanings.sent3: During the play, the character's exaggerated ecphrasis of the landscape painting caused laughter in the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her ecphrasis of the ancient artifact was so detailed that listeners could almost see it before their eyes.
meanings.sent5: The ecphrasis of the majestic castle in the novel made it a central character in the story.

meanings.definition: The act of describing a work of art in a literary or verbal form.
meanings.sent1: The art critic's ecphrasis of the painting captured every brushstroke and color.
meanings.sent2: Her ecphrasis of the sculpture highlighted its intricate details and emotional depth.
meanings.sent3: In the art class, the students engaged in playful ecphrasis of each other's drawings.
meanings.sent4: His ecphrasis of the music performance painted a vivid picture of the sounds and emotions.
meanings.sent5: The poet's ecphrasis of the sunset brought the evening sky to life in the reader's mind.
